PublicFaq.Header: How do I scan a QR code?
PublicFaq.Content:
To scan a QR code open go the main page by pressing the back button and press the 'QR scanner' page.
Then when you bring your phone up to the QR page you wish the scan a popup will appear asking you if you wish to download the corresponding form for editing

To change app settings (Such as font size or dark mode) go the main page by pressing the back button and press the 'Settings' page.
Then to change settings tap the toggles/buttons.

PublicFaq.Header: How to access forms I have sent in the past?
PublicFaq.Content:
To access old forms go the main page by pressing the back button and press the 'Queue' page.
The queue page shows all forms that you have scanned on this device including previously send forms as well as forms that failed to send or still need to be filled in.
By pressing the delete button you can also delete forms you no longer wish to see or scanned by mistake.
By going to the 'Settings' page (Described above) you can also delete the entire queue for the currently logged in user.
Do not worry you cannot delete another user's files by mistake and will be asked to confirm you are sure you want to delete your queue.

PublicFaq.Header: How do I add my signature to a form I am editing?
PublicFaq.Content: Tap on the comment icon in the bottom right corner, then tap the pen icon that appears, also in the bottom right corner. Now draw your signature and press done. Resize your signature image by dragging one of the corners. Now move into the correct place with one finger

PublicFaq.Header: I downloaded a form and started editing it but didn't submit, where has it gone?
PublicFaq.Content: Press the back button to return to the main page, now press the queue page button and a list of all your downloaded forms will be there.
Press the back button to return to the main page, then press settings and click the log out button at the bottom of the screen.

AdminFaq.Header: How do I add a new form and QR code?
AdminFaq.Content:
To upload a form go to 'Upload new form', select the form you want to upload by pressing 'Open form' (The form MUST be a fillable PDF in order for it to be editable).
Then just select the form category and name. You will be given a QR code to print off and attach to the asset after pressing 'Upload form and generate QR code'.

AdminFaq.Header: How do I change the form email recipients?
AdminFaq.Content: Press the back button to return to the admin home page, then click the recipients button. Select a form type from the drop down and press submit to see the current recipient address for that type of form. To change the recipient email address enter a new email in the field below and press submit. All forms of the selected form type will now be sent to that email address.

To change app settings (Such as font size or dark mode) go the main page by pressing the back button and press the 'Settings' page.
Then to change settings tap the toggles/buttons.
Press the back button to return to the main page, then press settings and click the log out button at the bottom of the screen.

PrivacyPolicy.Header: 1. Purpose of processing and types of data collected
PrivacyPolicy.Content:
While you are logged on to the engie.com website, you may provide us with personal data such as :
- Identification data 
- Connection data (IP addresses, event logs).

The data collected will be used for the following:
to ensure content performance and provide the best possible user experience.

With this data, we can focus the structure and routes preferred by users. For example, making it easy to download a press release or optimising the search for information on engie.com by suggesting the shortest possible route, etc. Your personal data will not be processed further in any way that is incompatible with the purposes described above.

PrivacyPolicy.Header: 2. Not all the personal data collected is compulsory. Automated decision-making
PrivacyPolicy.Content: The processing does not involve automated decision-making.

PrivacyPolicy.Header: 3. The legal basis for processing your data
PrivacyPolicy.Content: "The data contained in this form are collected by ENGIE SA on the basis of consent."
Your personal data is kept only for the time required for the corresponding purposes.

As part of the data-processing, the Engie SA service providers responsible for the website are given access to the personal data collected. Should your data be disclosed to other third parties, i.e. internal services at ENGIE SA, ENGIE will comply with applicable law on the communication of personal data.

The information given on the forms must be objective and must not be excessive or insulting in any case. The forms must not contain sensitive data or information (racial or ethnic origin; political, philosophical or religious opinions; trade union membership; data concerning health or sex life; offences, convictions or detention orders).

For your information, please note that this type of information will not be processed and will be erased.

PrivacyPolicy.Header: 7. Security and confidentiality of your data
PrivacyPolicy.Content: In its capacity as data controller, Engie S.A. has in place appropriate measures to ensure the security and confidentiality of your personal data and, in particular, to prevent it from being distorted, damaged or accessed by unauthorised third parties.

In accordance with applicable regulations, you may request the correction or erasure of your data by logging into the account you created during registration. You may also exercise your rights of opposition, limitation and data-portability.

You may also exercise all and any of these rights by contacting us at:
https://engiegbs.service-now.com/gdpr_portal?id=gdpr_subject_access_request&sysparm_source=%20engiedotcom
by post to Direction des communications - 1 place Samuel Champlain, Faubourg de l’Arche 92930 Courbevoie, France.

You are also hereby informed that you may submit a request to the CNIL (Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés, the French Data Protection Authority). You may access its site at https://www.cnil.fr/fr.

ENGIE has appointed a Data Protection Officer with the Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (CNIL), who may be contacted as follows:

TermsOfUse.Header: 8. Information to potential users of ethics whistleblowing system ethics@engie.com
TermsOfUse.Content:
Entity responsible for the whistleblowing system: ENGIE SA.

Objectives pursued and areas concerned:
Financial, accounting, banking and anti-corruption
Anti-competitive practices
Fight against discrimination and harassment in the workplace
Health, occupational health and safety
Protection of the environment

The ethics whistleblowing system ethics@engie.com is open to all stakeholders of the ENGIE Group: employees, regardless of their employment status, customers, suppliers … Its use is strictly voluntary and can not be made compulsory.

Recipients of alerts: people who are specifically responsible for handling ethical alerts. It is not excluded that information collected by this device may be communicated to another entity of the Group in order to allow the processing of ethical reporting in accordance with legal provisions, in particular by taking all necessary measures to ensure compliance with confidentiality and security of the elements thus transmitted.

The persons identified under this scheme may exercise their right of access and rectification directly to: ethics@engie.com.

Any abuse of the device may be prosecuted.
